SEARCH
Package game.body.items

Class Inventory

java.lang.Object
game.body.items.Inventory
public final class Inventory extends Object
Inventory class that stores items in a list. The inventory has a fixed capacity and can add, remove, and use items. The inventory maintains the order and position of items.
Since:
04-03-2025
Author:
Alexander Smolowitz, alexander.smolowitz@city.ac.uk

  • Constructor Details

    • Inventory

      public Inventory(int capacity)
      Constructor for the Inventory class.
      Parameters:
      capacity - the capacity of the inventory.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the capacity is not an even number.

  • Method Details

    • addItem

      public boolean addItem(ItemFrame item)
      Adds an item to the inventory.
      Parameters:
      item - the item to add.
      Returns:
      true if the item was added, false if the item already exists in the inventory.

    • removeItem

      public void removeItem(ItemFrame item)
      Removes an item from the inventory.
      Parameters:
      item - the item to remove.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the item is not found in the inventory.

    • getInventoryPath

      public ArrayList<String> getInventoryPath(int buffer)
      Returns the inventory image path for all inventoryItems with a buffer zone.
      Parameters:
      buffer - the buffer zone of null values before Icons are added.
      Returns:
      inventory image path for all inventoryItems.

    • drop

      public void drop(int index)
      Drops the item from the inventory at the specified index.
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the item to drop.

    • use

      public void use(int index)
      Uses the item from the inventory at the specified index by calling ItemFrame.use() as per its API.
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the item to use.
